 1915: get_location(Term) ->
 1916:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{cursor_y} #{cursor_x}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1917:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1918:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1919: 
 1920: get_window_size(Term) ->
 1921:     RowAndCol = tmux("display -pF '#{window_height} #{window_width}' -t "++Term#tmux.name),
 1922:     [Row, Col] = string:lexemes(string:trim(RowAndCol,both)," "),
 1923:     {list_to_integer(Row), list_to_integer(Col)}.
 1924: 
 1925: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch) ->
 1926:     check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, #{}, 5).
 1927: check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1928:     Opts = #{},
 1929:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1930:         #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1931:         Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1932:     end,
 1933:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1934:                 {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1935:                     re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1936:                 error ->
 1937:                     OrigContent
 1938:                 end,
 1939:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(NegativeMatch), [unicode]) of
 1940:         {match,_} ->
 1941:             io:format("Failed, found '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1942:             [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1943:             io:format("Failed, found '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1944:                         [unicode:characters_to_binary(NegativeMatch), Content]),
 1945:             ct:fail(match);
 1946:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1947:             ok;
 1948:         _ ->
 1949:             timer:sleep(500),
 1950:             check_not_in_content(Term, NegativeMatch, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1951:     end.
 1952: check_content(Term, Match) ->
 1953:     check_content(Term, Match, #{}).
 1954: check_content(Term, Match, Opts) when is_map(Opts) ->
 1955:     check_content(Term, Match, Opts, 5).
 1956: check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt) ->
 1957:     OrigContent = case Term of
 1958:                   #tmux{} -> get_content(Term);
 1959:                   Fun when is_function(Fun,0) -> Fun()
 1960:               end,
 1961:     Content = case maps:find(replace, Opts) of
 1962:                   {ok, {RE,Repl} } ->
 1963:                       re:replace(OrigContent, RE, Repl, [global]);
 1964:                   error ->
 1965:                       OrigContent
 1966:               end,
 1967:     case re:run(string:trim(Content, both), lists:flatten(Match), [unicode]) of
 1968:         {match,_} ->
 1969:             ok;
 1970:         _ when Attempt =:= 0 ->
 1971:             io:format("Failed to find '~ts' in ~n'~ts'~n",
 1972:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1973:             io:format("Failed to find '~w' in ~n'~w'~n",
 1974:                       [unicode:characters_to_binary(Match), Content]),
 1975:             ct:fail(nomatch);
 1976:         _ ->
 1977:             timer:sleep(500),
 1978:             check_content(Term, Match, Opts, Attempt - 1)
 1979:     end.
 1980: 
 1981: get_content(Term) ->
 1982:     get_content(Term, "").
 1983: get_content(#tmux{ name = Name }, Args) ->
 1984:     Content = unicode:characters_to_binary(tmux("capture-pane -p " ++ Args ++ " -t " ++ Name)),
 1985:     case string:split(Content,"a.\na") of
 1986:         [_Ignore,C] ->
 1987:             C;
 1988:         [C] ->
 1989:             C
 1990:     end.
 1991: 
 1992: %% Tests that exit of initial shell restarts shell.
 1993: exit_initial(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1994:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 1995: 	old ->
 1996:             test_exit_initial(old);
 1997:         new ->
 1998:             test_exit_initial(old),
 1999:             test_exit_initial(new)
 2000:     end,
 2001:     ok.
 2002: 
 2003: test_exit_initial(old) ->
 2004:     rtnode:run(
 2005:       [{putline, ""},
 2006:        {putline, "2."},
 2007:        {expect, "2\r\n"},
 2008:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2009:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2010:        {putline, ""},
 2011:        {putline, "35."},
 2012:        {expect, "35\r\n"}],
 2013:       [], [], ["-oldshell"]);
 2014: test_exit_initial(new) ->
 2015:     rtnode:run(
 2016:       [{putline, ""},
 2017:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2018:        {putline, "2."},
 2019:        {expect, "2"},
 2020:        {putline,"exit()."},
 2021:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2022:        {expect, "1> $"},
 2023:        {putline, "35."},
 2024:        {expect, "35\r\n"}]).
 2025: 
 2026: stop_during_init(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2027:     {RunErl,_ToErl,[Erl|ErlArgs]} = rtnode:get_progs(),
 2028:     case rtnode:create_tempdir() of
 2029:         {error, Reason} ->
 2030:             {skip, Reason};
 2031:         Tempdir ->
 2032:             XArg = " -kernel shell_history enabled -s init stop",
 2033:             rtnode:start_runerl_command(RunErl, Tempdir, "\\\""++Erl++"\\\""++ErlArgs++XArg),
 2034:             Logs = rtnode:read_logs(Tempdir),
 2035:             rtnode:dump_logs(Logs),
 2036:             nomatch = binary:match(map_get("erlang.log.1", Logs),
 2037:                                    <<"*** ERROR: Shell process terminated! ***">>),
 2038:             ok
 2039:     end.
 2040: 
 2041: %% This testcase tests that the correct wrapping characters are added
 2042: %% When a terminal has the xn flag set, it means that wrapping may not
 2043: %% work as expected and historically the ttysl driver has always inserted
 2044: %% a " \b" (i.e. space + backspace) when an output string ends on that line
 2045: %% in order for the cursor to be at col 0 on the next line instead of col max
 2046: %% on the current line.
 2047: %%
 2048: %% This caused problems when a string was `columns` long and then ended in "\r\n"
 2049: %% as it would first wrap due to " \b" and then output "\r\n" that cause a double
 2050: %% newline to happen.
 2051: %%
 2052: %% This testcase tests that we get a " \b" when we should and we get a "\r\n" when
 2053: %% we should.
 2054: wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2055:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2056:         new ->
 2057:             As = lists:duplicate(20,"a"),
 2058:             rtnode:run(
 2059:               [{putline, "io:columns()."},
 2060:                {expect, "{ok,20}\r\n"},
 2061:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2062:                {expect, As ++ " \b"},
 2063:                {putline, ["io:format(\"~s~n~s\",[lists:duplicate(20,\"a\"),lists:duplicate(20,\"a\")])."]},
 2064:                {expect, As ++ "\r\n" ++ As ++ " \b"}
 2065:               ],
 2066:               [],
 2067:               "stty rows 40; stty columns 20; ");
 2068:         _ ->
 2069:             ok
 2070:     end,
 2071:     ok.
 2072: 
 2073: %% This testcase tests that shell_history works as it should.
 2074: %% We use Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p] in order to navigate up
 2075: %% We use Ctrl + N = Cp=[$\^n] in order to navigate down
 2076: %% We use Ctrl + B = Cp=[$\^b] in order to navigate left
 2077: %% in the console. We also need to sleep for a while in order
 2078: %% for the system to update the display before we enter more
 2079: %% commands.
 2080: shell_history(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2081:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "basic"),
 2082:     rtnode:run(
 2083:       [{putline, "echo1."},
 2084:        {expect, "echo1\r\n"},
 2085:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2086:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"},
 2087:        {putline, "echo3."},
 2088:        {expect, "echo3\r\n"},
 2089:        {putline, "echo4."},
 2090:        {expect, "echo4\r\n"},
 2091:        {putline, "echo5."},
 2092:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"}
 2093:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2094:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2095:     rtnode:run(
 2096:       [{sleep,100},
 2097:        {putline, ""},
 2098:        %% the init:stop that stopped the node is dropped
 2099:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2100:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2101:        {expect, "echo5\r\n"},
 2102:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo5[.]$"},
 2103:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2104:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2105:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2106:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo3[.]$"},
 2107:        {putdata, [$\^n]}, {expect, "echo4[.]$"},
 2108:        {putdata, [$\^b]}, {sleep,50}, %% the echo4. (cursor moved one left)
 2109:        {putline, ["ECHO"]},
 2110:        {expect, "echo4ECHO\r\n"}
 2111:       ], [], [],
 2112:       mk_history_param(Path)),
 2113:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 2114: 
 2115:     %% ignore input given after io:get_line, and after h(module) pager
 2116:     rtnode:run(
 2117:        [{putdata, "io:get_line(\"getline>\").\n"},
 2118:         {expect, "getline>"},
 2119:         {putline, "hej"}, {expect, "hej\r\n"},
 2120:         {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "\\Qio:get_line(\"getline>\")\\E[.]$"}
 2121:        ], [], [],
 2122:        mk_history_param(Path)),
 2123:     ok.
 2124: 
 2125: shell_history_resize(Config) ->
 2126:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "resize"),
 2127:     rtnode:run(
 2128:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2129:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2130:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2131:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2132:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","123456"] ++
 2133:           mk_history_param(Path)),
 2134: 
 2135:     {ok, Logs} =
 2136:         rtnode:run(
 2137:           [{sleep,100},
 2138:            {putline, ""},
 2139:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$$"},
 2140:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2141:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2142:            {expect, "echo"}
 2143:           ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history_file_bytes","654321"] ++
 2144:               mk_history_param(Path)),
 2145: 
 2146:     rtnode:check_logs(
 2147:       "erlang.log.1",
 2148:       "The configured log history file size is different from the size "
 2149:       "of the log file on disk", Logs),
 2150: 
 2151:     ok.
 2152: 
 2153: shell_history_eaccess(Config) ->
 2154:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "eaccess"),
 2155:     file:make_dir(filename:dirname(Path)),
 2156:     ok = file:make_dir(Path),
 2157:     {ok, Info} = file:read_file_info(Path),
 2158:     try
 2159:         NoExecMode = Info#file_info.mode band (bnot 8#111),
 2160:         file:write_file_info(Path,Info#file_info{ mode = NoExecMode }),
 2161: 
 2162:         %% Cannot create history log in folder
 2163:         {ok, Logs1} =
 2164:             rtnode:run(
 2165:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2166:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2167:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2168: 
 2169:         ct:log("~p",[Logs1]),
 2170:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs1),
 2171: 
 2172:         %% shell_docs recursively creates the folder to store the
 2173:         %% logs. This test checks that erlang still starts if we
 2174:         %% cannot create the folders to the path.
 2175:         {ok, Logs2} =
 2176:             rtnode:run(
 2177:               [{putline, "echo."},
 2178:                {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2179:               ], [], [], mk_history_param(filename:join(Path,"logs"))),
 2180: 
 2181:         rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Error handling file", Logs2)
 2182: 
 2183:     after
 2184:         file:write_file_info(Path, Info)
 2185:     end,
 2186:     ok.
 2187: 
 2188: shell_history_repair(Config) ->
 2189:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair"),
 2190: 
 2191:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2192:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2193: 
 2194:     {ok, Logs} =
 2195:         rtnode:run(
 2196:           [{putline, ""},
 2197:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2198:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2199:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2200:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2201: 
 2202:     %% The regexp below checks that he string is NOT part of the log
 2203:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2204:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired",
 2205:                       false,
 2206:                       Logs),
 2207:     ok.
 2208: 
 2209: shell_history_repair_corrupt(Config) ->
 2210:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "repair_corrupt"),
 2211: 
 2212:     %% We stop a node without closing the log
 2213:     shell_history_halt(Path),
 2214: 
 2215:     %% We corrupt the disklog
 2216:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read,append]),
 2217:     ok = file:write(D, [10,10]),
 2218:     ok = file:close(D),
 2219: 
 2220:     {ok, Logs} =
 2221:         rtnode:run(
 2222:           [{putline, ""},
 2223:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2224:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2225:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2226:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2227: 
 2228:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1",
 2229:                       "The shell history log file was corrupted and was repaired.",
 2230:                       Logs),
 2231:     ok.
 2232: 
 2233: shell_history_corrupt(Config) ->
 2234:     Path = shell_history_path(Config, "corrupt"),
 2235: 
 2236:     %% We initialize the shell history log with a known value.
 2237:     rtnode:run(
 2238:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2239:        {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2240:        {putline, "echo2."},
 2241:        {expect, "echo2\r\n"}
 2242:       ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2243: 
 2244:     %% We corrupt the disklog.
 2245:     {ok, D} = file:open(filename:join(Path,"erlang-shell-log.1"), [read, append]),
 2246:     ok = file:write(D, [10, 10]),
 2247:     ok = file:close(D),
 2248: 
 2249:     {ok, Logs} =
 2250:         rtnode:run(
 2251:           [{putline, ""},
 2252:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo2[.]$"},
 2253:            {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "echo[.]$"},
 2254:            {putdata, [$\n]},
 2255:            {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2256:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path)),
 2257: 
 2258:     rtnode:check_logs("erlang.log.1", "Invalid chunk in the file", Logs),
 2259:     ok.
 2260: 
 2261: %% Stop the node without closing the log.
 2262: shell_history_halt(Path) ->
 2263:     try
 2264:         rtnode:run(
 2265:           [{putline, "echo."},
 2266:            {expect, "echo\r\n"},
 2267:            {sleep, 2500}, % disk_log internal cache timer is 2000 ms
 2268:            {putline, "halt(0)."},
 2269:            {expect, "\r\n"},
 2270:            {sleep, 1000} %% wait for node to terminate
 2271:           ], [], [], mk_history_param(Path))
 2272:     catch
 2273:         _:_ ->
 2274:             ok
 2275:     end.
 2276: 
 2277: shell_history_path(Config, TestCase) ->
 2278:     filename:join([proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2279:                    "shell_history", TestCase]).
 2280: 
 2281: mk_history_param(Path) ->
 2282:     ["-kernel","shell_history","enabled",
 2283:      "-kernel","shell_history_path","\"" ++ Path ++ "\"",
 2284:      "-kernel","shell_history_drop","[\"init:stop().\"]"
 2285:     ].
 2286: 
 2287: shell_history_custom(_Config) ->
 2288:     %% Up key: Ctrl + P = Cp=[$\^p]
 2289:     rtnode:run(
 2290:       [{expect, "1> $"},
 2291:        %% {putline, ""},
 2292:        {putdata, [$\^p]}, {expect, "0[.]"},
 2293:        {putdata, [$\n]},
 2294:        {expect, "0\r\n"},
 2295:        {putline, "echo."},
 2296:        {expect, "!echo\r\n"} % exclamation mark is printed by custom history module
 2297:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2298:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2299:     ok.
 2300: 
 2301: shell_history_custom_errors(_Config) ->
 2302: 
 2303:     %% Check that we can start with a node with an undefined
 2304:     %% provider module.
 2305:     rtnode:run(
 2306:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2307:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2308:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history","very_broken",
 2309:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2310: 
 2311:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2312:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2313:     rtnode:run(
 2314:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2315:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2316:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2317:                   "-kernel","provider_load","crash",
 2318:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2319: 
 2320:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2321:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2322:     rtnode:run(
 2323:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2324:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2325:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2326:                   "-kernel","provider_load","badreturn",
 2327:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2328: 
 2329:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2330:     %% that crashes in load/0.
 2331:     rtnode:run(
 2332:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2333:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"},
 2334:        {expect, "(Disabling shell history logging.|echo)"}
 2335:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2336:                   "-kernel","provider_add","crash",
 2337:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2338: 
 2339:     %% Check that we can start with a node with a provider module
 2340:     %% that return incorrect in load/0.
 2341:     rtnode:run(
 2342:       [{putline, "echo."},
 2343:        {expect, "It returned {error,badreturn}.\r\n"},
 2344:        {expect, "echo\r\n"}
 2345:       ], [], [], ["-kernel","shell_history",atom_to_list(?MODULE),
 2346:                   "-kernel","provider_add","badreturn",
 2347:                   "-pz",filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE))]),
 2348: 
 2349:     ok.
 2350: 
 2351: load() ->
 2352:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_load) of
 2353:         {ok, crash} ->
 2354:             error(crash);
 2355:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2356:             %% Should return a list of string()
 2357:             ok;
 2358:         _ ->
 2359:             ["0.\n\n"]
 2360:     end.
 2361: 
 2362: add(_Line) ->
 2363:     case application:get_env(kernel,provider_add) of
 2364:         {ok, crash} ->
 2365:             error(crash);
 2366:         {ok, badreturn} ->
 2367:             %% Should return ok
 2368:             {error, badreturn};
 2369:         _ ->
 2370:             io:format("!", [])
 2371:     end.
 2372: 
 2373: %% Tests that local shell can be started by means of job control.
 2374: job_control_local(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2375:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2376: 	old ->
 2377: 	    %% Old shell tests
 2378: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2379: 	new ->
 2380: 	    %% New shell tests
 2381: 	    rtnode:run(
 2382:               [{putline, ""},
 2383:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2384:                {putline, "2."},
 2385:                {expect,  "\r\n2\r\n"},
 2386:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2387:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2388:                {putline, "s"},
 2389:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2390:                {putline, "c"},
 2391:                {expect,  "\r\nEshell"},
 2392:                {expect,  "1> $"},
 2393:                {putline, "35."},
 2394:                {expect,  "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2395:                {expect,  "2> $"},
 2396:                {putline, "receive M -> M end.\r\n"},
 2397:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2398:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2399:                {putline, "i 3"},
 2400:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2401:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2402:                {putline, "i 2"},
 2403:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2404:                {putline, "c"},
 2405:                {expect,  "[*][*] exception exit: killed"},
 2406:                {expect,  "[23]>"},
 2407:                {putline, "\^g"},
 2408:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2409:                {putline, "k 3"},
 2410:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2411:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2412:                {putline, "k 2"},
 2413:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2414:                {putline, "k"},
 2415:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2416:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2417:                {putline, "c"},
 2418:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2419:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2420:                {putline, "i"},
 2421:                {expect,  "Unknown job"},
 2422:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2423:                {putline, "?"},
 2424:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2425:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2426:                {putline, "h"},
 2427:                {expect,  "this message"},
 2428:                {expect,  "--> $"},
 2429:                {putdata, "\t"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2430:                {sleep, 100},
 2431:                {putline, ""},
 2432:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2433:                {putdata, "\^r"}, %% Test that we don't crash
 2434:                {sleep, 100},
 2435:                {putline, ""},
 2436:                {expect,  "^\r\n\r\n --> $"},
 2437:                {putline, "c 1"},
 2438:                {expect, "\r\n"},
 2439:                {putline, "35."},
 2440:                {expect, "\r\n35\r\n"},
 2441:                {expect, "[23]> $"}
 2442:               ]),
 2443:             ok
 2444:     end.
 2445: 
 2446: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control.
 2447: job_control_remote(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2448:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2449: 	old ->
 2450: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2451: 	_ ->
 2452:             {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ args => ["-connect_all","false"],
 2453:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2454:             try
 2455:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2456:             after
 2457:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2458:             end
 2459:     end.
 2460: 
 2461: %% Tests that remote shell can be started by means of job control to
 2462: %% -noshell node.
 2463: job_control_remote_noshell(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2464:     case proplists:get_value(default_shell, Config) of
 2465: 	old ->
 2466: 	    {skip,"No new shell found"};
 2467: 	_ ->
 2468: 	    {ok, Peer, NSNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{ name => peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2469:                                              args => ["-connect_all","false","-noshell"],
 2470:                                              peer_down => continue }),
 2471:             try
 2472:                 test_remote_job_control(NSNode)
 2473:             after
 2474:                 peer:stop(Peer)
 2475:             end
 2476:     end.
 2477: 
 2478: test_remote_job_control(Node) ->
 2479:     RemNode = peer:random_name(test_remote_job_control),
 2480:     Pid = spawn_link(Node, fun() ->
 2481:                                    receive die ->
 2482:                                            ok
 2483:                                    end
 2484:                            end),
 2485:     PidStr = erpc:call(Node, erlang, pid_to_list, [Pid]),
 2486:     true = erpc:call(Node, erlang, register, [kalaskula,Pid]),
 2487:     PrintedNode = printed_atom(Node),
 2488:     CookieString = printed_atom(erlang:get_cookie()),
 2489: 
 2490:     rtnode:run(
 2491:       [{putline, ""},
 2492:        {putline, "erlang:get_cookie()."},
 2493:        {expect, "\r\n\\Q" ++ CookieString ++ "\\E"},
 2494:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2495:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2496:        {putline, "r " ++ PrintedNode},
 2497:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2498:        {putline, "j"},
 2499:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2500:        {expect, "2[*] {\\Q"++PrintedNode++"\\E,shell,start,\\[]}"},
 2501:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2502:        {putline, "c"},
 2503:        {expect, "\r\n"},
 2504:        {expect, "Eshell"},
 2505:        {expect, "\\Q(" ++ atom_to_list(Node) ++")1> \\E$"},
 2506:        {putline, "whereis(kalaskula)."},
 2507:        {expect, PidStr},
 2508:        {putline, "kalaskula ! die."},
 2509:        {putline, "exit()."},
 2510:        {expect, "[*][*][*] Shell process terminated!"},
 2511:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2512:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2513:        {putline, "j"},
 2514:        {expect, "1  {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2515:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2516:        {putline, "c"},
 2517:        {expect, "Unknown job"},
 2518:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2519:        {putline, "c 1"},
 2520:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[12]> $"},
 2521:        {putdata, "\^g"},
 2522:        {expect, " --> $"},
 2523:        {putline, "j"},
 2524:        {expect, "1[*] {shell,start,\\[init]}"},
 2525:        {putline, "c"},
 2526:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"},
 2527:        {sleep, 100},
 2528:        {putline, "35."},
 2529:        {expect, "\\Q("++RemNode++"@\\E[^)]*\\)[123]> $"}
 2530:       ], RemNode),
 2531:     Pid ! die,
 2532:     ok.
 2533: 
 2534: %% Tests various control keys.
 2535: ctrl_keys(_Config) ->
 2536:     Cu = [$\^u],
 2537:     Cw = [$\^w],
 2538:     Cy = [$\^y],
 2539:     Home = [27,$O,$H],
 2540:     End = [27,$O,$F],
 2541:     rtnode:run(
 2542:       [{putline,""},
 2543:        {putline,"2."},
 2544:        {expect,"2"},
 2545:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cw++"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+W
 2546:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2547:        {putline,"\"hello "++Cu++"\"world\"."},	% test <CTRL>+U
 2548:        {expect,"\"world\""},
 2549:        {putline,"world\"."++Home++"\"hello "},	% test <HOME>
 2550:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2551:        {putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++End++"\"."},	% test <END>
 2552:        {expect,"\"hello world\""},
 2553:        {putline,"\"hello world\""++Cu++Cy++"."},
 2554:        {expect,"\"hello world\""}] ++
 2555:           wordLeft() ++ wordRight()),
 2556:     ok.
 2557: 
 2558: wordLeft() ->
 2559:     L1 = "\e\e[D",
 2560:     L2 = "\e[5D",
 2561:     L3 = "\e[1;5D",
 2562:     wordLeft(L1) ++ wordLeft(L2) ++ wordLeft(L3).
 2563: 
 2564: wordLeft(Chars) ->
 2565:     End = "\eOF",
 2566:     [{putline,"\"world\""++Chars++"hello "++End++"."},
 2567:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2568: 
 2569: wordRight() ->
 2570:     R1 = "\e\e[C",
 2571:     R2 = "\e[5C",
 2572:     R3 = "\e[1;5C",
 2573:     wordRight(R1) ++ wordRight(R2) ++ wordRight(R3).
 2574: 
 2575: wordRight(Chars) ->
 2576:     Home = "\eOH",
 2577:     [{putline,"world"++Home++"\"hello "++Chars++"\"."},
 2578:      {expect,"\"hello world\""}].
 2579: 
 2580: %% Test that -remsh works
 2581: remsh_basic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2582:     {ok, Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(),
 2583:     TargetNodeStr = printed_atom(TargetNode),
 2584:     [_Name,Host] = string:split(atom_to_list(node()), "@"),
 2585: 
 2586:     PreCmds = [{putline,""},
 2587:                {putline,"node()."},
 2588:                {expect, "\\Q" ++ TargetNodeStr ++ "\\E\r\n"}],
 2589: 
 2590:     PostCmds = quit_hosting_node(),
 2591: 
 2592:     %% Test that remsh works with explicit -sname.
 2593:     HostNode = atom_to_list(?FUNCTION_NAME) ++ "_host",
 2594:     HostNodeStr = printed_atom(list_to_atom(HostNode ++ "@" ++ Host)),
 2595:     rtnode:run(
 2596:       PreCmds ++
 2597:           [{putline,"nodes()."},
 2598:            {expect, "\\Q" ++ HostNodeStr ++ "\\E"}] ++
 2599:           PostCmds,
 2600:       HostNode, " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2601: 
 2602:     %% Test that remsh works without -sname.
 2603:     rtnode:run(PreCmds ++ PostCmds, [], " ", "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr),
 2604: 
 2605:     %% Test that if multiple remsh are given, we select the first
 2606:     rtnode:run([{expect, "Multiple"}] ++ PreCmds ++ PostCmds,
 2607:                [], " ",
 2608:                "-remsh " ++ TargetNodeStr ++ " -remsh invalid_node"),
 2609: 
 2610:     peer:stop(Peer),
 2611: 
 2612:     ok.
 2613: 
 2614: %% Test that if we cannot connect to a node, we get a correct error
 2615: remsh_error(_Config) ->
 2616:     "Could not connect to \"invalid_node\"\n" =
 2617:         os:cmd(ct:get_progname() ++ " -remsh invalid_node").
 2618: 
 2619: quit_hosting_node() ->
 2620:     %% Command sequence for entering a shell on the hosting node.
 2621:     [{putdata, "\^g"},
 2622:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2623:      {putline, "s"},
 2624:      {expect, "--> $"},
 2625:      {putline, "c"},
 2626:      {expect, ["Eshell"]},
 2627:      {expect, ["1> $"]}].
 2628: 
 2629: %% Test that -remsh works with long names.
 2630: remsh_longnames(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2631:     %% If we cannot resolve the domain, we need to add localhost to the longname
 2632:     Domain =
 2633:         case inet_db:res_option(domain) of
 2634:             [] ->
 2635:                 "@127.0.0.1";
 2636:             _ -> ""
 2637:         end,
 2638:     Name = peer:random_name(?FUNCTION_NAME),
 2639:     case rtnode:start(" -name " ++ Name ++ Domain) of
 2640:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2641:             try
 2642:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2643:                     rtnode:start("-name undefined" ++ Domain ++
 2644:                                      " -remsh " ++ Name),
 2645:                 try
 2646:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2647:                            SNode,
 2648:                            STPid,
 2649:                            [{putline, ""},
 2650:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2651:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2652:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2653:                            CNode,
 2654:                            CTPid,
 2655:                            [{putline, ""},
 2656:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2657:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2658:                 after
 2659:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2660:                 end
 2661:             after
 2662:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2663:             end;
 2664:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2665:             Else
 2666:     end.
 2667: 
 2668: %% Test that -remsh works without epmd.
 2669: remsh_no_epmd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2670:     EPMD_ARGS = "-start_epmd false -erl_epmd_port 12346 ",
 2671:     Name = ?CT_PEER_NAME(),
 2672:     case rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2673:                       EPMD_ARGS ++ " -sname " ++ Name) of
 2674:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, SNode, SState} ->
 2675:             try
 2676:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2677:                        SNode,
 2678:                        STPid,
 2679:                        [{putline, ""},
 2680:                         {putline, "node()."},
 2681:                         {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"}], 1),
 2682:                 {ok, _CRPid, CTPid, CNode, CState} =
 2683:                     rtnode:start([],"ERL_EPMD_PORT=12345 ",
 2684:                                  EPMD_ARGS ++ " -remsh "++Name),
 2685:                 try
 2686:                     ok = rtnode:send_commands(
 2687:                            CNode,
 2688:                            CTPid,
 2689:                            [{putline, ""},
 2690:                             {putline, "node()."},
 2691:                             {expect, "\\Q" ++ Name ++ "\\E"} | quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2692:                 after
 2693:                     rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(CState))
 2694:                 end
 2695:             after
 2696:                 rtnode:dump_logs(rtnode:stop(SState))
 2697:             end;
 2698:         {skip, _} = Else ->
 2699:             Else
 2700:     end.
 2701: remsh_expand_compatibility_25(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2702:     {ok, _Peer, TargetNode} = ?CT_PEER(#{}), %% Create a vsn 26 node
 2703:     NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode), %% compatibility
 2704:     %% Start a node on vsn 25 but run the shell on vsn 26
 2705:     case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh "++NodeName, [{release, "25"}|Config]) of
 2706:         {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2707:             try
 2708:                 ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2709:                        STPid,
 2710:                        [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2711:                         {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2712:                         quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2713:             after
 2714:                 Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2715:                 rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2716:             end;
 2717:         Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2718:     end.
 2719: remsh_expand_compatibility_later_version(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 2720:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2721:     case ?CT_PEER_REL([], "25", PrivDir) of
 2722:         not_available -> {skip, "25 not available"};
 2723:         {ok, _Peer, TargetNode}  ->
 2724:             NodeName = atom_to_list(TargetNode),
 2725:             %% Start a node on later version but run the shell on vsn 25
 2726:             case rtnode:start(peer:random_name(), "stty columns 200; ERL_AFLAGS= ", "-remsh " ++ NodeName, Config) of
 2727:                 {ok, _SRPid, STPid, _, SState} ->
 2728:                     try
 2729:                         ok = rtnode:send_commands(undefined,
 2730:                             STPid,
 2731:                             [{putdata, "erlang:is_atom\t"},
 2732:                              {expect, "\\Qerlang:is_atom(\\E"}|
 2733:                              quit_hosting_node()], 1)
 2734:                     after
 2735:                         Logs = rtnode:stop(SState),
 2736:                         rtnode:dump_logs(Logs)
 2737:                     end;
 2738:                 Else when element(1, Else) =/= ok -> Else
 2739:             end
 2740:     end.
 2741: 
 2742: printed_atom(A) ->
 2743:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format("~w", [A])).
